summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the search of compact discs (FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, and 22) seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations of Title 18, U.S. Code, Sections 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors), including communications, photographs, videos, and records concerning victims.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Issued the search and seizure warrant for compact discs seized from Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Seizure of Evidence from Epstein Residence
events.description: Compact discs stored in containers marked with FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, and 22 were seized from the residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY.

events.title: Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The search warrant commanded execution on or before July 21, 2019.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes search of compact discs (FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, 22) seized from Epstein's New York residence on or about July 7, 2019.
The search is for evidence of violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors).
Items to be seized include communications regarding victims, photographs of teenage girls, child erotica, and records of device ownership/use.
The warrant allows forensic imaging and review of electronically stored information (ESI) using techniques like keyword searches and file reviews.
The warrant was issued by U.S. Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses and had to be executed by July 21, 2019.
